lender.name: Natalie

lender.name: Dale

lender.occupational_info: I create retirement plans.

lender.name: erin

lender.occupational_info: i go to school!!!

lender.name: Roger
lender.loan_because: It helps someone
lender.occupational_info: Hopefully, helping people with our equipment issues.

lender.name: Kate
lender.loan_because: It is the right thing to do.
lender.occupational_info: A teacher

lender.name: J Marina
lender.loan_because: my dear brother-in-law, Daniel Maneely, died last week and since he generously watched over many people I make these initial loans in his memory. Also I was a single mother for many years and I wish to pass on some of the blessings I received from friends and family to enable women to have a means of support for themselves and their families, and to have the independence and peace of mind that good work brings.
lender.occupational_info: My life's work involves books and children. I have been a librarian, a bookseller and a reading addict always. Later in the year I hope to retire and help to care for my grandchldren who live 5000 miles away, to expand their school library and to write.

lender.name: Jonathon
lender.loan_because: I love empowering people.
lender.occupational_info: Finished cross-country walk (kivawalk.com), working part-time in communications for non-profit in Denver, CO & building new project (walk2connect.com)

lender.name: Eric
lender.loan_because: I like to help people
lender.occupational_info: I specialize in the medical care of children

lender.name: Dhruv
lender.loan_because: Little Drops of Water, Little Grains of Sand, Makes the Mighty Ocean and the Pleasant Land

lender.name: QUAN
lender.loan_because: we are supposed to help each other because we are all in this together.

lender.name: Rishia
lender.loan_because: I know what it's like to work hard, yet I also know that I am lucky to live where I do.
lender.occupational_info: This is not about me.

lender.name: Jacklin and Wendy
lender.loan_because: I am going to reire somewhere along the way in the next few months. I would like some day to visit some of the places where our money has helped other people, just to meet them and learn from them about life in their communities.

lender.name: Marcie
lender.loan_because: the amount of money to the folks we contribute can make such a difference to their quality of life.

lender.name: Caleb & Carrie
lender.loan_because: We have the resources to help.
lender.occupational_info: We work in education.

lender.name: Allen
lender.loan_because: it's the most sensible way to use the internet

lender.name: John
lender.loan_because: Micro-finance is one way that even a graduate student can help to make the world a better place.

lender.name: Sylvia & Billy
lender.loan_because: We want to make a difference and help someone realize their dreams of a better life.
lender.occupational_info: I talk to doctors and tell them about the medicines my company produces.

lender.name: Dave
lender.occupation: President of Big Brothers Big Sisters of Colorado
lender.loan_because: micocredit is such an effective tool. In the last 8 years the government of the USA has invested little in the people of our world. Our new leadership will hopefully find better ways, but in the mean time we should not wait. The world will change when a human being is empowered.
lender.occupational_info: I lead an organization that recruits and trains caring adults who volunteer to be a friend s to a children who are missing a parent. We create hundreds of these one-to-one mentoring relationships. I also work with gang involved youth with www.thespotdenver.org.

lender.name: sandy
lender.loan_because: I feel that people need to be independent and have a sense of self-worth. If they have a desire to work hard and provide for their families, then it is very worthwhile to help them.
lender.occupational_info: I work with children in the school system and help them and the teacher with school problems and social situations.

lender.name: Mary
lender.loan_because: It was a gift to me, and I want to share it with others. I hope their lives will be blessed by this loan.
lender.occupational_info: I create printed wiring boards that are used in many different types of electronic devices.

lender.name: Ben
lender.occupational_info: I support science teachers in changing the way science is taught to young people.

lender.name: Angelique
lender.occupational_info: I make art.

lender.name: Lenja F. Papp
lender.loan_because: I don't want to be someone who did nothing because he could do only a little.
lender.occupational_info: Being in love with radio, I devote my business life to teach/help Slovenian companies to use radio more effectively. I'm the founder of RAB SI (Radio Advertising Bureau) SLOVENIA - the only Slovenian advertising agency 122% specialized in radio advertising and teaching about radio.

lender.name: Chelsea
lender.loan_because: I believe that this website is helping change the world and I want to be a part of that.

lender.occupational_info: I teach English to military cadets.

lender.name: Manoj
lender.loan_because: If we can provide aid to individuals who need help to support their family through their business but need some assistance financially, then we believe it's a no-brainer to give them a hand.
lender.occupational_info: I help individuals and organizations succeed online by designing strategies in regards to: Search Engine Optimization, Paid Search, Web Analytics, Usability and Social Media Optimization

lender.name: Lauren
lender.loan_because: I believe that people across the world want what we want - security for family, opportunity to provide for family and a peaceful environment in which to live. Providing small loans offers a pathway to each of these goals.

lender.name: Kody
lender.loan_because: It changes the world for the better.
lender.occupational_info: I work with computers and servers, I enable people through technology.

lender.name: paula

lender.occupational_info: Nice clean and easy

lender.name: Stefano
lender.loan_because: I can and I need to do something for poor people, for me

lender.name: Oliver and Ingemar
lender.loan_because: I think the loan make a difference for a person or a family.

lender.name: Ellie
lender.loan_because: I struggle every day to make ends meet and if I have a little left over I want to lend it to someone like me that is trying to succeed and better themselves and their families.
lender.occupational_info: I am not able to work due to disabilities however, I am actively involved in environmental issues in my community. I also make my own cleaning supplies, personal supplies and such with all organic and natural products. I grow herbs and vegetables in containers and am trying to organize a community garden for next spring.

lender.name: Becky
lender.loan_because: Everyone deserves a chance to make their life better.
lender.occupational_info: I approve mortgages for those who are seeking to purchase their first homes, or refinance their current homes.

lender.name: caitlin
lender.occupational_info: I teach the little children to do things, and i keep them from harming each other (or at least, seriously harming each other). And I love them. That's pretty much it.

lender.name: Brian
lender.loan_because: We are obligated by faith to help those around us better thier lives.

lender.name: Crazy Cat Lady
lender.loan_because: ...what could possibly be the argument against it?

lender.name: Bruce

lender.occupational_info: I help individuals build their investment portfolios, create income and retire safely.

lender.loan_because: We are all connected.
lender.occupational_info: I find better, less expensive way to do what we already do through the use of technology.

lender.name: Tyler Gooch
lender.loan_because: I enjoy it.
lender.occupational_info: I manage a team of people who administer computer applications for students and staff at an agricultural/vocational college.

lender.name: Hong
lender.loan_because: I can help others make positive changes.

lender.name: Frances
lender.loan_because: I have enjoyed traveling in several African countries and would like to assist an entrepreneur in growing her business.

lender.occupation: A 6th grader at discovery middle school
lender.loan_because: i know someone who is trying to start a business and i know how hard it is!

lender.name: Supergirl
lender.loan_because: I feel that low-interest lending is a positive way to impact the lives of real hard working people in a way that helps them become self-sustained individuals, families, and communities. Sometimes all you need is a push to get you going!
lender.occupational_info: I use computers and technology to develop ways to organize, communicate, and share information with others. I also make and sell jewelry in my spare time. The money from both of these jobs go into the loans I make.

lender.name: Jason
lender.loan_because: I have been helped in my life so I am just repaying old debts.

lender.name: Kevin
lender.loan_because: business success leads social change

lender.name: Megan
lender.loan_because: People matter.

lender.name: Maxim
lender.loan_because: Everyone does better when every one does better. We are all connected, and it is through helping one another that we can realize a better world.

lender.name: Alia
lender.loan_because: I'm lucky enough that I can.
lender.occupational_info: I fix other people's writing and generally do what I'm told.

lender.name: Joanne
lender.loan_because: it makes sense. It seems there's a long history of indifference to poverty in the world by those in countries who have more resources. I've found, however, there is little difference between me and the person on the other side of the globe who is trying to live a good life and raise a family in security. The only difference might be that we were born in different places, with different choices offered to us because of geography, politics and history. At this time I live in a time and place where I have a lot of choices and opportunity to work and live well. As a member of the larger human family it makes sense for me to live conscientiously, to act and distribute that wealth to others as we can so that others can enjoy a better quality of life. The Kiva program is a wonderful way to assist people, and it encourages personal responsibility and accountability with it's gift.
lender.occupational_info: I work in a non-profit health care clinic as a Nurse Practitioner. I diagnose and manage illnesses, injuries and diseases using medicines and other treatments. I try to help people live healthier lives and prevent illness.

lender.name: Kelly
lender.occupational_info: Manage worker information

lender.name: Hunter
lender.loan_because: I care about my friends in Ladkah and all over the world!
lender.occupational_info: 8th grade student in Boise Idaho

lender.name: Jim
lender.loan_because: It is good for the world.
lender.occupational_info: Marketing, PR, Social Media & Websites for lead generation.

lender.name: Samuel
lender.loan_because: many small loans can have a big impact

lender.name: P.L.S.K.
lender.occupational_info: Friends

lender.name: Carol
lender.occupational_info: I work with organizations committed to social justice.

lender.name: Clare
lender.loan_because: "Education doesn't make you happy, nor does freedom. We don't become happy just because we are free, or because we've been educated, but because education may be the means by which we realize we are happy. It opens our eyes, our ears; tells us where delights are lurking...Convinces us that there is only one freedom of any importance whatsoever- that of the mind. And, gives us the assurance , the confidence, to walk the path our mind, our educated mind, offers." -Iris Murdoch
lender.occupational_info: I teach children to read, write, and express themselves.

lender.name: Yvon
lender.loan_because: It is the best way to help someone in his project

lender.occupational_info: I'm a Mom of a bounding 2 year old, and am blessed to have one more on the way. My background is a co-director of a non-profit foundation that does HIV/AIDS education in East Africa.

lender.loan_because: I can.

lender.name: tuxboss
lender.loan_because: I believe in the old chinese saying that the only way to trully end someone's hunger is to teach them how to fish, not just give them the fish.

lender.occupation: Executive Director of the GNOME Foundation

lender.name: Mike
lender.loan_because: My wife and I want to make a difference in the world. We want to give something back to a world that's been kind to us.
lender.occupational_info: I own and operate 17 restaurants with my wife Ashlie.

lender.name: Joseph
lender.loan_because: Solidarity is the best medicine for what ails us as a species

lender.name: Annekathrin and Axel
lender.loan_because: We travel a lot and have been impressed by the commitment and creativity of many people to realise their work and ideas in spite of many problems, oftentimes with a big smile. Kiva gives us a chance to help a bit.
lender.occupational_info: We work in the area of European environmental research and programming.

lender.loan_because: It is a great way to help people help themselves.
lender.occupational_info: As a mediator, I act as a neutral third party and help people and corporations settle their disputes quickly and peacefully throughout Texas.

lender.name: Dave
lender.occupational_info: I oversee the design and manufacture of men's clothing for an American fashion brand.

lender.loan_because: Our original loan was a Christmas gift from some dear friends. Our 2nd loan was an Easter gift for the kids to share with someone somewhere.

lender.loan_because: I can.

lender.name: Blanche
lender.loan_because: all a person needs at time is a chance and someone to have a little faith in them.
lender.occupational_info: I take care of children from birth to 12 years.

lender.name: Jo Scheiffers
lender.loan_because: I can help people directly with small amounts.
lender.occupational_info: I work in a Credit Union so I understand how this sort of lending can be important to people who want to stand on their own two feet.

lender.name: Mary
lender.loan_because: I am blessed and I like to share my blessings with others.
lender.occupational_info: I own and run a small Christian bookstore.

lender.name: Erica
lender.loan_because: I want to help those less fortunate than I am

lender.name: Kate
lender.loan_because: I care.

lender.name: Amelia
lender.loan_because: I'm getting my kids involved in helping others, and this is a nice way to feel connected to the global community.
lender.occupational_info: I am currently looking at how to help patients and physicians work with medical interpreters.

lender.name: Brian (Shadowfoot)
lender.loan_because: I can.
lender.occupational_info: I make peoples jobs easier.

lender.name: Zamaana
lender.loan_because: "The prosperity of a people is proportionate to the number of hands and minds usefully employed." - Samuel Johnson
lender.occupational_info: Zamaana was created as a simple initiative to create prosperity through art. Artists throughout the world sell artwork on our website. From the proceeds of these sales, we contribute 50% as microloans.

lender.name: Gwen
lender.loan_because:
Kivas concept & implementation of it is brilliant. Ive always believed in giving someone a hand up over a hand out when possible. You know, teach them to fish and Kivas plan allows me to do just that.
When I read some of these loan stories and see what their business is and what they need the money for, I am really taken aback at how a significant portion of the world still lives. It causes me to take stock not only in my life and what I have to be grateful for, but in myself and what I have to give. It is incredible that so little from us can have such a huge impact to anothers life.
Getting updates on how the borrower has used my loan, in conjunction with yours, to improve their business and change their lives, allows me to continue feeling involved and SEE how my loan worked. And even though Im just giving them a chance to help themselves, it still feels very rewarding to see others grow.
Because I make a LOAN, not a donation, I get to keep lending the money to others when it's repaid. The same $25 can help so many different people! Thank you Kiva!
~We are the World~
lender.occupational_info: Hiatus Vice President of KnockOuts for Girls Advisory Committee for Food on Foot

lender.name: Ben, Anna and Blake
lender.loan_because: It is important for entrepreneurs in poor communities to have access to credit

lender.name: Dan
lender.occupation: Transaction Management Software for Real Estate

lender.name: Laura
lender.occupational_info: mind numbing

lender.name: John
lender.loan_because: It is easy to do...and makes such a huge impact in the lives of those in need.
lender.occupational_info: I'm a retired Colonel, Air Force helicopter rescue pilot, and owner of "J. Cherniga Images". I sell my photographic art at Art Festivals statewide in Florida.

lender.name: Sarah
lender.loan_because: Even though I don't have a lot of money, I am rich in many other ways. I hope that in some small way I can give something back to those that have given me so much by helping others along the way.
lender.occupational_info: I work at a Veterinary Clinic, helping the doctors treat injured or sick animals and helping people learn how to take care of their pets and livestock.

lender.name: Nancy
lender.loan_because: We're all in this together.

lender.name: Margaret
lender.loan_because: My small contribution may have a huge impact on someone's life. It is but by chance, that I have a comfortable life. The day may come that I find myself in need and I can only hope that some kind soul will reach out to me.

lender.name: Susan
lender.loan_because: It's a good thing to do....and I can.

lender.name: Janine & Edgar
lender.loan_because: I can.
lender.occupational_info: I write and edit communications.

lender.name: Bonnie
lender.loan_because: I want to help people who are trying to help themselves.
lender.occupational_info: I work with school-age children who have disabilities and who need help to get the most out of their education.

lender.name: Benjamin
lender.loan_because: God is enormously generous in my life and it is something that he would want me to do.
lender.occupational_info: I am a student in a public school here in America. I hope to be a mathematician when I am older.

lender.name: galina
lender.loan_because: happiness for me comes when my work and words are of benefit to others.

lender.name: Samson Midiwo
lender.loan_because: I need to upgrade my business by installing permanent electricity which cost kenya shillings 35,000 and buy a new television set which cost about Kshs. 62,000 to catch up with competition which is coming up and this video hall is now my only source of livelyhood after losing my job.I make about 15,000 every month but on a good month i can make upto 25,000 on which i pay 5,810 for the cable TV, and 4,000 for the land i leased to set up the hall, and the rest i use it for my upkeep and some little savings. Thanks
lender.occupational_info: I have a small hall which i built with a little help from my friends, to put up a sports club house where people watch live football matches from europe, basket ball, athletics and other sports. This has helped the community at large since before idle youths used to indulge in drugs since they did not have anything to do.

lender.name: Christophe
lender.loan_because: That's the right things to do

lender.name: Saretta
lender.loan_because: " To whom much has been given, much is expected"
lender.occupational_info: I push papers, review legal documents, and provide support to victims after tragic experiences.

lender.name: Anne
lender.loan_because: because I am a kind angel full of loveliness and soft hair...
lender.occupational_info: Nurse/Midwife

lender.name: Khristova
lender.loan_because:
wegnant It was a shock for me. It was a shock for my man too. Very often he kicked up a row. Because of the nervous overstrain I had a premature baby. My baby was dead. I asked my man to take me to the hospital but he said that it was too expensive for him and he left me to die. I had been ill for a long time. Later he said that if I wanted to live in his house I had to work. I began to work. But I was very ill. It was very difficult for me. I took medicines all the time. On the 1st of May 2002 I lost consciousness and came to my senses in the hospital. I needed the urgent operation. It was like a hell for me. But I was thinking ibout my children all the time. I couldn't leave them. And these thoughts gave me power .0 overcome all the difficulties I had. But still I had very many problems My elder daughter divorced her husband and became to live with me. My former husband made me .^-ell the flat in the hostel. I got only 2,5 thousand dollars. I paid for my operation and ^ treatment. Since 2002 we had been living in a room of 12 m . There were five of us - me, :ny two daughters, my granddaughter and my old grandmother. In 2007 my grandmother died. For this period we couldn't buy a flat or a house. Later my mother came to live with me and now there are five of us. It is very difficult to live in such conditions. A year ago my daughter had an operation. Now she is pregnant. Thanks to God she "s planning to get married in September. I hope that she will be happy. But we have no residence registration. We lost it after our flat in the hostel was sold. Practically we don't exist now. We have no right to vote. Even our passports became invalid because we have no right to renew them. My younger daughter has no right to receive a passport in spite of she fact that she is 18. She is pregnant now but she has no right to receive baby allowance. i! have no right to receive money credit to improve my situation. Besides the owner of the house where we live tries to get rid of us. After the death of my grandmother I received the Dart of the house in the village where my grandmother lived. But we can't live in the house oecause it is very old and needs reconstruction. I want to return to my native village from Melitopol where I have no home. I want 10 work in the garden. I like vine-growing. I have collected literature about vine-growing, vine-making etc. By chance I got to know that I can apply for money credit on your site. I didn't nake business plan but I made a list of operations which are needed to organize a goo.d vine-growing farm. I never asked for help for myself because I considered that there are very many people who needed help more than I needed it.
It so happened that since 19 years old when I have already been married I had not my own home. Now I am 45 but still I haven't my own home. My daughters were growing up in other people's homes: at first we lived in rented houses and since 1989 to 2000 we have been living in the hostel belonging to the plant where my husband was working. In spite of the fact that now we have many difficulties I couldn't help thinking about our life in the hostel with horror. We lived in the room of 10 - 12 m2. There were 4 of us. The kitchen of the hostel was used by 9 families, the toilet and the bathroom were used by 4 -5 families. We had to wait our own turn to the toilet or to the bathroom. We have been Jiving in the hostel for 13 years. My husband was a drunkard. My daughters suffered because of this. It became even dangerous for us to live in the room with drunkard. I decided to divorce him. In the former USSR there was a state fund of dwelling. And we were going to get our own dwelling from this fund. But later our country separated from the USSR and became independent and the state fund of dwelling didn't exist any more. We lost the opportunity to get our own dwelling. The lodgers of our hostels decided to organize the building company to reconstruct the hostel and turn it to the real dwelling for themselves. We were going to get the flat of 3 rooms in the house. But I had no right to 'ive in the house because I was divorced. My former house was going to get a flat of one room in the house. He had the right to get this flat because he was working in the plant. Fhe administration of the building company decided to evict me and my daughters from the hostel. But they couldn't do it according to the resolution of the court of law. The reconstruction began. My former husband was in the mental hospital. I was discharged from my work. So I had two daughters and had no means of substance. I was thinking only about livelihood at that time, not about the reconstruction. During the period :)f reconstruction all the conveniences in the house were disconnected. We had to look for temporary dwelling. My former husband didn't give me money for children because he oaid for the reconstruction of the hostel. But he deceived us. By chance I got acquainted with a man who needed some person to take care for his 11 mother. My children and I began to live in his house. I tried to do my best to be a good housewife. We practically lived as one big family. Two years later the master's mother died. My elder daughter got married and had a baby. I was almost happy. Sometimes we were speaking about the marriage with my master. But 2 months later he said that we had 10 leave his house. We had no place to live in any more. I fell ill. I got to know that 1 was
But now I think that it is high time to ask for help. I am sure that this money will help my family to overcome all the difficulties. I am sure that I will be able to return all the money in time. This is the information about me and I will be very grateful for your answer. Ukraine Zaporijie region Melitopol 23 October Str. 3/2 Khristova Svitlana SVN 604032 Issued by Melitopol state department of internal affairs in Zaporijie region The date of issue 16.07.2002
Stage-by-stage plan of mastering of credit. 1. Purchase of 3 of nearby areas: with buildings on tearing down - 2, empty - 1 accordingly: 5 000 $ + 4 000 $ + 1 000 $ = 10 000 $ 2. Protection of area with fence, renewal of plumbing branch, connecting of telephone: 4.5 000 $ 3. Purchase of transport vehicle for needs - truck of brand ofReno: 10 000 $ 4. Preparation of area and landing of nursery transplants in an amount 1000 bushes at price for 1 thing - 12 Uah - 2.4 000 $ v Well-boring for watering with the complete set of equipment: 1 000 $ 6. Sorting out of buildings, purchased on tearing down with the further use of build materials for building of economic houses: !- poultry house for 400 hens 115m2 cowshed for 2 cows with a maternity unit 30m2 f\ pigsty for 4 pigs with a feeding set 50m In all: 195m2 7. Purchase of cattle, pigs, hens for a subsidiary economy: 1) chickens of the egg breeds - Russian white breed, Orlovskaya breed, Hamburg breed, Minorka breed 200 hens 1) chickens of the meat breeds - 200 hens 5) 2 cows of black breed for 4 000 $ per 1 cow 8 000 $ T) pigs - of Ukrainian steppe white breed for 0.400 $ per a pig 1.600 $ 8. Building of a separate building from the used brick: 1) storage of forage, hayloft 50m2 2) building of silo pit, compost pit 9. Purchase of refrigerator chamber a volume 400 1 for freezing of products of stock-raising and poultry farming: 0.650 $ 10. Planning and preparation of area of 0,06ga under a vegetable garden and garden, with [he purpose of providing of necessities of family in vegetable and fruit products. 11. Production of the initial stages of building of house: foundation, box, roof, partitions, windows, doors with the use of modem, economical materials, building services. 21850 $
2. Satisfaction of necessities of family due to the products of subsidiary economy, vegetable garden, garden; satisfaction of financial necessities due to realization of surpluses of stock-raising, poultry farming, vegetable garden, garden. 3. Credit return: due to an income, got from realization of products of viticulture and vine making. 14. Prospects of development: Fo beginning of the mass fruiting of vine to build an apartment for storage and processing of vine, to purchase equipment for processing of vine, to prepare an apartment for storage of wine, order making of winy barrels, during 3 years prepare an area for landing of nursery transplants of vine in an amount from 500 to 1000 bushes. 15. Overzall sum of credit: 60 000 $

lender.name: Lisa
lender.loan_because: I am amazed that what we, in the United States, see as a small amount of money can make a lifetime of difference to someone in a less prosperous country. I believe that any person who is willing to work hard to help themselves deserves a chance (and a boost, if necessary) to get their plans rolling.
